casebody.data:
No. 09-8714. Tomas D. Cuesta, Sr., Petitioner v. Wisconsin. 559 U.S. 1001, 130 S. Ct. 1902,

176 L. Ed. 2d 358,

2010 U.S. LEXIS 2364. March 22, 2010.

Motion of petitioner for leave to proceed in forma pauperis denied, and petition for writ of certiorari to the Court of Appeals of Wisconsin dismissed. See Rule 39.8. As petitioner has repeatedly abused this Court’s process, the Clerk is directed not to accept any further petitions in noncriminal matters from petitioner unless the docketing fee required by Rule 38(a) is paid and petition submitted in compliance with Rule 33.1. See Martin v. District of Columbia Court of Appeals, 506 U.S. 1, 113 S. Ct. 397, 121 L. Ed. 2d 305 (1992) (per curiam). Justice Stevens dissents. See id., at 4, 113 S. Ct. 397, 121 L. Ed. 2d 305, and cases cited therein.

Same case below, 322 Wis. 2d 123, 779 N.W.2d 177.
